column5: Someone years ago gave me the Nick Name  : JEN  It stuck , so when online rather than use my real name which is rather long I use my alter ego... heck, she fishes better than me anyways!  LOL  JEN is so much easier to type then BERNADETTE

Mine is named after a cartoon.  Lexington (called 'Lex' for short) is the smallest gargoyle in the Manhattan Clan. He became the clan's unofficial techie, taking leadership whenever technical obstacles needed to be overcome.  Add another 'X' for originality and thats me..

My nickname is pretty simple. My first name is Ken and my buddy LJ (Little John), speaking of nicknames, often says in a cool tone "What's up Mr. Kennyman" or something very similar (different variations) and since it was the only nickname I really ever had (other than lardass,idiot etc.) it sort of stuck. That and if you try to use Ken,Kenny etc. it's usually been taken. This reminds me ........... hmmm ..... how about a little story here?   Has anyone ever done this?Remember this is a LONG time ago.  I'm out of town with a long time friend Scott (no nickname) on one of our spur of the moment "missions". We come out of a coffee shop and right above where we are parked is a street sign for "Little John Lane". Needless to say, we couldn't get out the wrenches fast enough. That sign was brought home with us and donated to Little John. He still has it to this day. Man, to be young and foolish again ............ or at least young.

Some great reading here.  Joey, that was priceless!  I'm not sure if Bly can make Tacos or not.  I do know that she makes an awesome lunch and some wicked cookies.  No reason why she can't make up a great taco as well.  I came up with Fishnsled because of my love of fishing and sledding many years ago and it has just stuck with me.
Right outside of Leesburg Virginia.30 miles nothwest of DC. Joe
That is close to where Raf works and where I will be living.  Sounds like Southern Swills may be in order.

my grand dad called me that when i was young as i would skip school,and do bad things to go fishing like sneaking out of the house and stuff all to go fishing,so he would call me a little fishindevil....so i just started using it....then i found pictures of it and sort of adopted them.....cheers    great thread,
Yup, like PF says.  Very close.. Mapquest says it's 90 miles from where my butt is right now in Edgewood MD
Better pack your lunch if your going to hang with Raf
Anytime you you want to head west Raf you are welcome here. Joe

Last name is Bunker.  Live in Moose Factory, work in Moosonee, located on the Moose River, all of which are in Moose township.  Grew up in Perth though, then lived in Ottawa, then Attawapiskat... but, PerthOttawaAttawapiskatMooseFactoryBunk kinda made me sound retarded when I would say it 5 times fast.   Tonyb. haha, Tonya was taken.
Dang Raf and PF stateside? a few bars of Yankee Doodle Dandy?
Watch out yankee chickens.  I hope you grow yours with 4 wings!!!
PF my friend ,you are also welcome here anytime but the chicken house is off limits to you! Joe
Mine's Finn for walleye, I mean pickeral.

For me it started in 2005 I went ot Quinte for the first time out of 3 boats mine was the one that caught Pike and Pike and Pike while I watched my buddies fillet walleyes and me well there was pike and more pike.So that weekend my buddies called me Mike the Pike. Previous years I caught lots of pike and yes I ate others Walleye.Last year one of my customers called me Mike the Pike.I had joined another board and used Mike the Pike as my board name .Last November cousin Percher told me about this wonderful site and I continued with Mike the Pike.I have never caught a Pike bigger than 8lbs but man I have caught alot of hammer handles in the 3 to 4 pound range.So thats it I am Mike the Pike.

Well for many yrs my close freinds have allways called me AMO.  I actually got this nick name back in Europe & i mean nick name. It actually is short for Amazon.....Being that i am 6ft tall and blonde this is how this nick name for me came about & i have had it for many yr's. I am known by most as amo on other boards. But i tired of it and decided i wanted something different.  I thought Nautifish was very much me!
My wife said I was not allowed to be Masterb8t anymore.  So she told me what my new name will be  Oh well, she always catches more fish on the hard water, so I will let her be right, for now.
your not the first masterbaiter nor will you be the last.  G
no problem here I say if you are good at something be proud of it
Not in sales of......... Laid these for 30+ years.
I'll second that Wayne, very funny!!!
Doug is my name, and G is the initial of my last name.  I used to be dougG, but I decided that one G was plenty.
One can never have enough Gs, yo!
Best to Rafal,  time for a lunch some day?  Roti, pho, jerk chicken, your call.
How quick can you get down to Maryland?  Sounds good Doug.  I'm back in .ca next week.
I will be closer to you in two weeks, Raf.  Another week in Hanover PA, beginning on superbowl sunday!
The southern contingent is growing!Not so far far away from y'all now. Joe
Whereabouts in Virginia are you?
My parents are kangaroos  Here's dear old Dad    Joey
LOL Joey...love it!!!
Totally funny Joey.  :lol:  :lol:   Had a few good laughs tonight. Chat was really good until Bill changed the subject
Sorry there Bernie... Ohh i Got it BTW if you weren't there for that part

I can too make tacos!!  My handle......  Like many others, I use a nickname online for the anonymity.  When I first needed an online nickname, a friend suggested 2 that she thought fit, used both for many years but finally settled on this one.  Both names are from the Xanth novels by Piers Anthony.   blyght which is now bly cause I am lazy lol

I was Jedi Angler on several other boards, but got tired of using the SHIFT button. Now I'm just jediangler. The name actually comes from my job. I'm in the heattreating business. I had to FISH out parts that fell off hooks and into a 4ft deep pot of 1400 F molten salt with a long stainless steel hook. You couldn't see the bottom so you had to feel around with the hook to locate the missing parts. Although I wore the silver suit and other appropriate heat resistant gear, my face would get cooked looking into the molten pot. I covered the shield on my helmet so that I was blind (kinda like Luke Skywalker with his blast shield down while practising his light saber). I always managed to out fish the other guys by Fishing with the Force.

Back in the earlier days of CB radio I lived up in French River and one evening we were in a bar listening to a band, they had this rubber chicken hanging up by the stage and one of my buddies dared me to steel it which sounded like a good idea at the time so I did (it's OK, I did return it LOL). Anyway the next day my buddies started calling me the chicken thief. About a week later I got my first CB radio and since everyone used handles I had to come up with one. It ended up being "The Northern Ontario Chicken Thief" which I used for years. There are still some collector cards around from way back then somewhere.  When I started getting into message boards, that handle just didn't seem appropriate any more and since my name is Cliff and my son's name is Cliff our friends often refered to us as Big Cliff and Little Cliff..... Big Cliff just sort of stuck.
I remember when I first joined the board and introduced myself as Cliff, someone chimed in and said I had to leave because there was already a very well respected member here with that name...LOL.
I used to live in the wilds of NorthWestern On. and do a little guiding and also some people out there call me an artist.  Here's a sample for the handle.  Bushart
LOL Glenn actually I can`t sit, or walk on water.
Its a state of mind

Made it my Licence plate in the 80's. Used it as a C.B. handle,now it's my internet handle everywhere. Fishing sites,cribbage sites,poker sites..etc.etc.etc.  Oh yah......RHYBAK is a Ukrainian work that mean Fisherman.
My first boat was/is a mistyriver.     Just spare us any pics in your avatar.  There are members of all ages on here.
I used the handle Terry because  what's his name was taken  edit  ok what you can't even post the name..LOL it changed to  "what's his name ".....LOL  now that's funny
That's a Dilly of a story, Terry.
He who can't be named is Valdemoort.  Ya I have kids who watch Harry Potter.

Purely promotion of my business........... And I think Holdfast has the origin of handles on CB's. Mine was Jobhunter. I was perpetually unemployed as a youth and so was always lookin for a job. A WORK job! before you get the wrong idea. Albert
I didn't want a number or underscore in my hotmail account name so i just started typing in random crap, actually took quite a while but i found one lickmyarmpit@hotmail

camillj - My first Vax username (back in '79)... and on about 200 Vaxes around the province ... first six letters of last name and first initial (it was an industry standard) ...was also my All-in-1 email address (wayyyyyy before email was common) became my real-life nickname by co-workers  and baseball team (I was, in those days at least, a VAX GOD and a star 1st  baseman!) ... pronounced CA-MILL-JAY ... ok I admit did also have to put up with "camel-jockey" (last name is Camilleri) first name is Jon (as in Jonathan) ... so there it is ... and there ya go.
Danbo is short for Danny Boy. Cheers from Dan Reid
Mine is somthing I made up for internet sign-in (what it meens probably only matters to me) when I got my first computer and it's easy to type. My first name is Bill...
I think why people use Handles is best sumed up by Brad Paisly in hes song ONLINE
You may be a little premature in your statement, from the sounds of your handle maybe a loner  Glen you can psss off
I fish shiningtree every year and many people from Ontario have the same problem.... it's not easy to find fish and stay on them on the main lakes  most of the camps are on

I used to tease my grandchildren by telling them "I think you are full of beans"...  Gotta be careful what you say to kids as I became known as "Grampa Beans"...  One of the young gaffers couldn't say the whole thing so he just called me "Beans"...  The whole family picked up on it and I now get "Beans" more often than my real name...  So by the time I got on the internet...it was a given...
Tonya was taken
Mine is based on what would be my ideal annual income.  Oh, it's my name too.  I dunno.. people are still calling me "Big Bass Rich" everywhere I go.
Mine is what relatives called our boat, based on our store name.  I still put my name on everything as I have nothing to hide and as a shameless plug as well

mine comes from my college days, i was in a fraternity called theta chi,  which has the greek letters OX and since i helped pay my way through college showing and grooming purebred cattle and working cow sales and farm work they nicknamed me cowboy, so it just stuck with me oxcowboy.  jason
Mine states my preferences for fishing. Except through the ice when I'll chase just about anything that has fins.
I talk to much, the lure slowly sinks and..,
he sets the hook  a fight ensues  it's a new PB  Log.  He then says "snag"
CCMT= Can't Catch Many Things = Carole can't make tacos = Cliff's Carole's Man Toy
I like football...
Real mature Snag...real mature.....         My kid can beat up your kid

1. Many other members seemed to have a handle.  2. When I first joined the site I hadn't really lurked all that long, and didn't know what I was getting into and thought the anonymity couldn't hurt.  No big deal.  My canoe (Green in colour) was made by someone who put the name one it. I think I tried Canoehead and Mr. Canoehead, but I'm not sure now?  Rob

Why can't we just all have normal handles, like me for instant.  No offenceto the member but I had a board member tell me that if I didn't change my handle people would not reply to my posts....  Any thoughts??

I tried drunkenposter but for some reason that one was taken years ago.... word has it some milwhacky drinking dwarf reserved it...  So due to my lack of imagination after a dozen or so I got fed up and used Gerritt..  Sad really... as Imagination is Intelligence having a bit of fun...  Ahhh well in another life I'll get it right.  G.

The thought occurred to me over the weekend "how did the name handle thing get started?". In the past in my old Citizen Band days (CB's for those are too young to remember) we used "handles" instead of our real names or our license number. The reason we used handles back then was because many were not licensed or would run more wattage than we were allowed to talk further away. Has this tradition carried to discussion boards in some manner? Mostly none of us here have little or nothing to hide from so I suppose it is all just for fun. Some people here use their real names Rick, Lew, Joey , Gerritt, Roy, Corey, Dan, Terry and so on. Then there are some folks who use their trade/profession for a handle; hometownhandyman, aplumma, daplumma, Hearingfish, Headhunter, BPSBASSMAN and so on. Then comes the possible appropriate ones. The first one that comes to mind is "misfish" Now I have never fished with Brian but why did he pick a name like that?  . Solopaddler is known for his forays into the wilderness on his own and his great posts on them. Moosebunk is also a great story teller with a fun twist to them. Now last but not least is the one that sticks out from all the rest, yes you guessed it, Greencoachdog   ????  What is that? Just thought I would toss in a little fun topic here.

Hey Bernie, its a good topic, I personally like to know whom I'm talking to, I like to use my real name-always have. I guess it's a choice-I getting to know a few of the guys for who they are like Brian aka Misfish , I don't have a problem with it just my prefferance. Mark
Eee doggies Bernie, I a picked this here handle so's I would fit in with the general populace of a fishun board.  I figured they would be ba able to relate, in a floksy down home sort a way.
Go here: http://www.yakimabait.com/catalog/html/Ori...il-p-16146.html Click on lure color and then look for my "handle" and click on it.

I started using a handle when first getting on the internet...kind of a safety net I guess, didn't always want people to know my real name until I was comfortable with them.  The handle was given to me years ago by an old friend/co-worker back in the SNL days  I liked it so I kept it....that's my story and I'm sticking to it  Maureen
Here it is!
I think you like my name Mark,MIS fish. LOL I would have no probs using my name,just seemed that it was thing to do,"have a handle name".

Handle ?  You guys making fun of me cuz' my Momma named me Hookset ?  Better stop it or I'm sending over "Toxic Bunk Muffin" That'll fix yer little patooty.  My sister always was a little over protective.    Hookset.

Great post...I've always wondered the same thing!  My handle came about from feeling "landlocked" due to living in town, at least an hour from water and having a passion for floatplanes, boats and fishing.  Pretty original eh?
Its a good name Brian, although I only like when my competitors Mis Fish! LOL

I use a handle cos the Yanks in Florida called me Nanook of the North!  I think if everyone used their real names ,it could get hectic.  I.E.     10   Mikes 15 joe's 5  Bills  Come to think of it, I could use Glen and cause a nice little upset
Where else could I use a name like MAster B8t and not be assumed to be some kind of perv???

Who said we didn't think you were not a perv??? LOL  Only kidding of course....  My first internet handle was "fret"...which is a part of a guitar...not someone who worries all the time.  It morphed into ccmt because many sites years ago had to have at least 4 characters to a username.  I added the 'canada' part because believe it or not, ccmt was taken already when I joined yahoo.  Some people thought I worked for the hockey company ccm, and others thought the cmt meant "Country music television".  If you've seen my band's videos, you know this is NOT the case...LOL.
Live in Ohio and used to fish, actually wasn`t to bad at it.
Typical "Buckeye", they go out and sit on the water and automatically think they're a Fisherman!
Ifish with these poor buggers from the Buckeye, always meet them in Shining Tree, short of a fish jumping in their boat, they couldn't catch a cold in the Arctic.
Mine is somewhat self explanatory until you know me

I always thought Greencoachdog was Alabannannas slang for not catching fish north of the mason dixon line.Daplumma is a nickname given to me years ago cause my last name is unpronouncable to most people that dont live in the swamps of Louisiana or Canada (Melancon).Good thread ,Bernie. Joe

Its funny before I got "back" into fishing I was an avid whitewater kayaker and used to frequent a paddlers forum where I always posted under my real name. I've been known to "get into it" with other posters from time to time(not here to many mods, LOL) and I would never hide behind some alias...But when I discovered the fishing sites like this one most people seemed to have a "handle" so I picked Pigeontroller since I have a trailer on Pigeon Lake and have spent many hours trolling for the elusive Muskie(I actually prefer casting). My given name is always in my signature, and my email is not hidden. As always, I stand behind what I say, and take responsibility for it.
My handle pretty much describes my fishing.
Don't think mines to hard to figure out!
i'm a pilot

DT10Sam,  Well my name is Sam and I am an avid trapshooter shooting at those miserable little orange targets flying through the air launched from a machine. DT10 is a high end gun manufactured by Beretta and ironically this year I am tournament shooting with a gun that was made for me called Caesar Guerini.  Well I am not about to change my handle at this stage. So if any of you guys are clay target shooters specifically trapshooting you will probably see me shooting this year as I get ready for the Provincial Championships and the Canadian Championships. I have had a 2 year rest from competitions and now I am ready to get back into it.  Regards, Sam

Holdfast is a Radio Handle meaning Combat Engineer in the Army.  You don't want to spell out to the Enemy that there are Engineers in the Area, or Starlite meaning Medic, Watchdog MP, Sunray your Commander.  Kind of Gives it away on what might be happening.  These days the nicknames really don't matter anymore with today's radio security, however nicknames still exist.  As far as using my real name, I don't think so unless I know someone.  I figure whilst using a public forum, probably better not to advertise who you are.  For example  being called a racist or getting someone angry because of my opinions or views as there are sensitive people who take things really personal or out of context.  There are weirdos out there.
Got that many trips back and forth to work already that they let you up front Raf?
